Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem step by step First I need to understand the requirements clearly The user provided a loan application process with strict rules and some recommended best practices desiderata They want me to analyze three cases based on these rules and identify which ones are violating the normative constraints and which are just not meeting the desiderata Starting with Part 1 Normative Process Behavior Strict Rules The key here is that the process must follow the exact sequence and order without skipping steps or reversing them Let me go through each case one by one

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Case 1 Looking at Case 1s timeline Application received at 0900 Credit Check at 0930 immediately after so thats good Risk Assessment at 1000 right after credit check so thats correct Loan Decision Approved at 1100 after risk assessment so thats okay Then Inform Applicant at 1300 after decision correct Then Finalize Documentation at 1330 since approved this must come before closing Close Case at 1400 Thats all in order No skips correct order The Finalize Documentation is before closing which is required for approved loans So this case is compliant with the normative rules It doesnt violate anything

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 Case 2s timeline Application received at 0800 Then Risk Assessment at 0820 Wait a second thats before the Credit Check The normative rule says Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment Here they did Risk Assessment first Thats a direct violation of the ordering rule Then they did Credit Check at 0900 which is after the Risk Assessment Thats not allowed So the sequence here is messed up The Credit Check cant be after the Risk Assessment So this case is violating the normative rules because the Credit Check was done after the Risk Assessment step which is not allowed Additionally after the Loan Decision rejected at 0930 they proceeded to Finalize Documentation at 1000 But the rule says if rejected you cannot finalize documentation before closing They closed the case at 1030 but they did finalize documentation after the rejection Thats another violation So two normative violations here incorrect order of Credit Check and Risk Assessment and finalizing documentation after rejection

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Case 3 Case 3s timeline Application received at 0900 Then Credit Check at 1400 Wait no Wait the timestamps looking back the Credit Check for Case 3 is listed as 20240114 1000 Wait the Application Received was on 20240112 0900 Then the next activity is Credit Check on 20240114 1000 Thats two days later The normative rules dont specify a time limit for Credit Check only that it must come before Risk Assessment But the desiderata recommend doing it within 24 hours However the desiderata arent strict rules So the Credit Check is late but according to the strict rules as long as its before Risk Assessment its okay Lets check the sequence here The Application Received is first Then the next activity is Credit Check on the 14th but before that theres a gap But the Risk Assessment is at 1100 on the same day 20240114 1100 So Credit Check 1000 comes before Risk Assessment 1100 so the order is correct here The Credit Check was delayed but the sequence is maintained However the Risk Assessment is on the same day as the Credit Check so thats okay Then Loan Decision is approved at 1200 Then Inform Applicant is at 1615 Wait no looking again the next activity after Loan Decision 1200 is Inform Applicant at 1500 on the 16th Wait thats two days after the Loan Decision The desiderata recommend informing within 48 hours so 48 hours after decision which was on Jan 14 would be by Jan 16 1500 Lets see 48 hours from Jan 14 1200 would be Jan 16 1200 so 1500 is 3 hours late Thats within the 48hour window Hmm maybe the exact timing is a bit off but the key point here is that the Inform Applicant is after the Loan Decision which it is The problem is that its delayed beyond the recommended 48 hours but thats a desideratum violation not a normative one The Finalize Documentation is at 1700 20240117 0900 wait no Wait the Finalize Documentation is listed as 20240117 0900 Wait no looking again at the table for Case 3 Wait the entries for Case 3 Application Received 20240112 0900 Then the next entry is Credit Check on 20240114 1000 So theres a gap here but the Credit Check is before Risk Assessment which is on 14th 1100 So sequence is okay Loan Decision Approved at 20240114 1200 Then the next activity is Inform Applicant at 20240116 1500 Wait thats two days after the decision 48 hours from the decision Jan 14 1200 would end on Jan 16 1200 So 1500 is 3 hours after the deadline so its late But thats a desideratum issue not a normative violation Then Finalize Documentation is on Jan 17 0900 which is after the Inform Applicant on Jan 16 1500 Thats okay because for approved loans Finalize must come before closing The closing is at 1000 on Jan 17 so Finalize is before that So thats correct The Finalize is done before closing so thats okay Additionally the Followup Call the desideratum recommends a followup call before closing But in Case 3 theres no mention of a followup call The last activity is Close Case on Jan 17 1000 The desideratum says its encouraged but not strictly required So not having a followup call is a desideratum violation but not a normative one So for Case 3 the normative constraints are all met Lets confirm Sequence Application Credit Check even though delayed but before Risk Assessment Risk Assessment Decision Inform Finalize after decision Close All steps are in order no skips So the normative rules are followed The delays in Credit Check time and informing after 48 hours are desiderata issues not strict violations

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now moving to the second part identify which cases fail the desiderata Desiderata are the recommended best practices but not strict rules So for each case check for 1 Credit Check within 24 hours of application 2 Inform applicant within 48 hours of decision 3 Perform Followup call before closing

Name: Validation - NE
Text: Case 1 Credit Check was at 0930 which is 30 minutes after application received Thats well within 24 hours Good Inform Applicant was at 1300 which is 25 hours after decision 1100 Way under 48 hours Good Followup call Not mentioned The case closed at 1400 but no followup call So missing the followup call Thats a desideratum violation Case 2 Credit Check was at 0820 but the application was received at 0800 Wait the Credit Check is at 0820 which is 20 minutes after application received Thats within 24 hours Wait but the problem in Case 2 was the ordering Credit after Risk But regarding timing for Credit Check it was done quickly so thats okay for desiderata Wait but the main desiderata issues here the Credit Check timing is okay The problem in Case 2 is the ordering normative violation and finalization after rejection another normative violation For the desiderata in Case 2 The Inform Applicant was at 1000 which is 30 minutes after the decision 0930 Thats within 48 hours Followup call Not mentioned The case closed at 1030 No followup call so thats a desideratum violation Case 3 Credit Check was on Jan 14 1000 which is 2 days after application received on Jan 12 Thats 48 hours later The desideratum recommends within 24 hours So thats a violation of the timing recommendation Inform Applicant was on Jan 16 1500 which was 3 hours after the 48hour window since decision was on Jan 14 1200 48 hours would end on Jan 16 1200 So thats a violation of the inform within 48 hours Followup call Not present The case closed on Jan 17 1000 so no followup call Another desideratum violation

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing Normative violations strict rules broken Case 2 has two normative violations 1 Credit Check after Risk Assessment sequence violation 2 Finalizing documentation after rejection since rejected must close without finalizing but they did finalize before closing Case 3 No normative violations The sequence is correct even though timings were off Desiderata violations recommended but not strict Case 1 No Credit Check timing issue but missed followup call So one desideratum violation missing followup Case 2 Credit Check timing was okay within 24h actually 20 minutes after application so thats good Inform was within 48h 30 mins after decision Missing followup call So only one desideratum violation no followup Case 3 Credit Check took 48 hours exceeding 24h recommendation Inform was 3 hours late over 48h No followup call So three desiderata violations here

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Now the user also asks for suggestions or justifications where possible Lets think about possible justifications For Case 2s Credit Check after Risk Assessment the process must strictly follow the sequence so theres no justification here Its a clear violation of the normative rules For the finalization after rejection in Case 2 the rule is explicit that if rejected you cant finalize before closing They did finalize before closing so thats a clear violation Case 3s Credit Check delay while the strict rules dont require a time limit the desiderata do The user might argue that the Credit Check was delayed due to an external factor like waiting for additional data but the process still followed the sequence However the normative rules dont allow for such delays in the sequence only the timing is a desideratum For the inform applicant in Case 3 being late again the strict rules dont require a time limit so the delay isnt a normative issue but its against the recommendation Maybe the system was overwhelmed or the decision took longer than expected but the process steps were followed correctly Followup call in all cases the desiderata recommend it but its not mandatory So in cases where its missing its just a best practice not enforced by rules So for justifications where possible perhaps in Case 3s Credit Check delay one could argue that the Credit Check was pending external data like a background check taking longer but the normative rules dont require that to be within a specific time However the user might still consider that a desideratum violation even if theres a reason Putting this all together the answers would be structured as 1 Normative violations Case 2 has two violations order and finalization after rejection Case 3 has none 2 Desiderata violations Case 1 missing followup call Case 2 missing followup call Case 3 Credit Check late inform applicant late no followup call Then for justifications where applicable like for Case 3s Credit Check delay but since the question says when possible perhaps only where theres ambiguity In this case the normative rules dont have time constraints so the delays in Credit Check and inform are just desiderata not normative So maybe no need for justifications unless the user wants to explain why certain things are considered violations or not So final answer would list each cases violations in each category explain why and note any justifications where applicable
